intro: Rhododon angulatus, commonly known as the angular rhododon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and angular, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and yellowish in color. Rhododon angulatus is often found in coastal and arid environments, where it has adapted to withstand harsh conditions.
